arm_group.description: Patch containing acyclovir  applied to cold sore
Patch without acyclovir  applied to cold sore

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will treat approximately 24 participants who experience cold sores. Patches will
      be applied to the cold sore for up to ten days, and the symptoms will be measured during
      daily clinic visits using non-invasive measurement techniques.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Exploratory Study to Investigate the Inflammatory Response During a Cold Sore Episode

group.description: Participants applied single patch containing acyclovir to the cold sore area. A maximum of 5 patches/ day were allowed during the 10 day study period. Baseline measures were determined for Safety population.
group.title: Acyclovir Patch

group.description: Participants applied single placebo patch to the cold sore area. A maximum of 5 patches/ day were allowed during the 10 day study period. Baseline measures were determined for Safety population.
group.title: Placebo Patch

group.description: Total of all reporting groups
group.title: Total

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was not formally powered to detect statistically significant differences, but to provide information for methods development and develop sample size calculation for future studies.

analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as first named treatment minus second named treatment, such that a negative difference favours the first named treatment.
analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered no difference between study treatments for TEV.
analysis.method_desc: ANOVA model with a factor for treatment group.

analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as first named treatment minus second named treatment, such that a negative difference favours the first named treatment.
analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered no difference between treatments for MEV.
analysis.method_desc: ANOVA model with a factor for treatment group.

outcome.description:
Measurement of blood flow was performed using Field Laser Perfusion Imaging (FLPI) technique.
Total episode value (TEV) was calculated as the summation of (test region response minus control region response) across all days.  Maximum episode value (MEV) was calculated as the maximum of (test region response minus control region response) across all days.

group.description: Participants applied single patch containing acyclovir to the cold sore area. A maximum of 5 patches/ day were allowed during the 10 day study period.
group.title: Acyclovir Patch

group.description: Participants applied single placebo patch to the cold sore area. A maximum of 5 patches/ day were allowed during the 10 day study period.
group.title: Placebo Patch

measure.description:
Measurement of blood flow was performed using Field Laser Perfusion Imaging (FLPI) technique.
Total episode value (TEV) was calculated as the summation of (test region response minus control region response) across all days.  Maximum episode value (MEV) was calculated as the maximum of (test region response minus control region response) across all days.
measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Blood Flow

outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) population: all randomized participants who had a patch applied to their cold sore and have at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement.
outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Blood Flow

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered no difference between study treatments for TEV (Day 1 to day 10).
analysis.method_desc: ANOVA model with a factor for treatment group.

analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as first named treatment minus second named treatment, such that a negative difference favours the first named treatment.
analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered no difference between study treatments for MEV.
analysis.method_desc: ANOVA model with a factor for treatment group.

outcome.description: Lesion thermographic parameters for TEV and MEV were analysed.

outcome.description: The redness of the cold sores to be measured and quantified using sophisticated, standardized and reproducible color photography. Parameter represents distance between test and control values according to a* axis and b* axis colour intensity values. The values on the scale ranged from -100 (green, lowest intensity) to +100 (red, highest intensity).

group.description: Participants applied single patch containing acyclovir to the cold sore area. A maximum of 5 patches/ day were allowed during the 10 day study period.
group.title: Acyclovir Patch

group.description: Participants applied single placebo patch to the cold sore area. A maximum of 5 patches/ day were allowed during the 10 day study period.
group.title: Placebo Patch

measure.description: The redness of the cold sores to be measured and quantified using sophisticated, standardized and reproducible color photography. Parameter represents distance between test and control values according to a* axis and b* axis colour intensity values. The values on the scale ranged from -100 (green, lowest intensity) to +100 (red, highest intensity).
measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Color Intensity of Lesions

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Color Intensity of Lesions

outcome.description:
Participants reported experience of the patch aesthetics and cold sore noticeability on the cold sore using a 5-point scale ( 1=Strongly Disagree 2=Rather Disagree 3=Neither Agree nor Disagree 4=Mostly Agree 5=Completely Agree) on 9 questions asked to them:
Today my sore felt completely protected
Today my cold sores interfered with facial movements such as smiling, eating or drinking
Today my cold sores interfered with my interaction with other people
Today the patch disguised my cold sores
Today I was bothered by the appearance of my cold sores
Today my patch was easy to apply
Today the patch covering my cold sores was bothersome
Today the patches stayed in place on my cold sores until I removed them
Today the patches were easy to remove from my lip or skin

outcome.description: Cold sore symptoms (pain, burning, itching) assessment was evaluated on a 5-point scale: 1=Never Bothered, 2=Rarely Bothered, 3=Bothered Some of the Time, 4=Bothered Often, 5=Bothered All the Time.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 105 screened, 60 underwent ultraviolet (UV) rays induction, 25 developed a cold sore and were randomized into the study.
participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.

group.description: Participants applied single patch containing acyclovir to the cold sore area.
group.title: Acyclovir Patch

group.description: Participants applied single placebo patch to the cold sore area.
group.title: Placebo Patch

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from UV exposure until the study completion assessments or the telephone follow-up for those participants not undergoing study completion assessments.

criteria.textblock:
Participants who are susceptible to cold sores that reactivate when exposed to ultraviolet
        (UV) light

facility.name: proDERM Institute for Applied Dermatological Research GmbH

clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study to Investigate the Inflammatory Response During a Cold Sore Episode

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Bundesinstitut für Arzneimittel und Medizinprodukte

primary_outcome.description:
Measurement of blood flow was performed using Field Laser Perfusion Imaging (FLPI) technique.
Total episode value (TEV) was calculated as the summation of (test region response minus control region response) across all days.  Maximum episode value (MEV) was calculated as the maximum of (test region response minus control region response) across all days.
primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Blood Flow

primary_outcome.description: The redness of the cold sores to be measured and quantified using sophisticated, standardized and reproducible color photography. Parameter represents distance between test and control values according to a* axis and b* axis colour intensity values. The values on the scale ranged from -100 (green, lowest intensity) to +100 (red, highest intensity).
primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Color Intensity of Lesions
